title: Extension of Time Period for Quarterly Reporting of Bank Officers' and Certain Employees' Personal Securities Transactions
summary: The FDIC has amended its regulation to extend the time period for reporting personal securities transactions from 10 business days to 30 calendar days after the end of the calendar quarter for officers and employees of state nonmember banks involved in customer account investment decisions.

regulation_details.regulation_name: Extension of Time Period for Quarterly Reporting of Bank Officers' and Certain Employees' Personal Securities Transactions

abstract: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) has finalized a rule amending the regulation regarding reporting of personal securities transactions by officers and certain employees of state nonmember banks involved in making investment decisions for customer accounts. The amendment extends the reporting deadline from 10 business days to 30 calendar days after the end of the calendar quarter, aligning it with SEC regulations. The FDIC received one comment supporting the amendment, emphasizing the goal of harmonizing reporting requirements and promoting uniformity.
